title: The ratio between the present ages of X and Y is 3 : 2 respectively. The ratio between X's age 5 years ago and Y's age 5 years hence is 1 : 1. What is the ratio between X's 5 years hence and Y's 5 years ago? - Quora

response.answer_text: The ratio of present ages of X and Y= 3 : 2 . Let it be= 3a:2a.Therefore X:Y= 3a:2a . The ratio of X's age 5- years ago and Y's age 5- years hence is3a-5=2a+5 = 1:1, {then a= 10}.So the present age of X= 30The present age of Y= 20Therefore the ratio of X's 5-years hence and Y's 5- years ago= 3a+5 : 2a- 5=35 : 15= 7 : 3

The present ages of X and Y can be taken as 3k years and 2k years respectively. Also we have (3k-5)/(2k+5) = 1:1=> k=10. So the present ages of X and Y are 30 years and 20 years respectively. Hence, ratio of X's age 5 years hence to Y's age 5 years ago = 35/15 = 7:3
